ygData.subject: Re: Shamans and Clerics
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi :) I play a cleric (among other things - I also have a monk, a paladin and a dark elf necromancer) on Bristlebane. My cleric is level 17 and engaged to be
ygData.messageBody:
Hi :)

I play a cleric (among other things - I also have a monk, a paladin and a
dark elf necromancer) on Bristlebane. My cleric is level 17 and engaged to
be married to a level 19 Barbarian Shaman.
We always play together and we really do some bad damage. He is playing the
healer and the tank and so do I. And both we rely on eachoter to heal and
tank. We have the perfect relationship hehehe.
Sometimes when we group I see that the others expect me to do nothing else
than healing..and yes..my spellbook becomes my world. Thats why I prefer to
explore the world at the side of my love, being respected as a fully equal
partner.

Tharca


>From: Suzanne Johnson <katannah@...>
>Reply-To: EQ_women@onelist.com
>To: EQ_women@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ_women] Shamans and Clerics
>Date: Sun, 27 Jun 1999 23:09:47 -0700
>
>From: Suzanne Johnson <katannah@...>
>
>Funny you should mention our nurturing vs. servile sterotypes. I was quite
>the little healer in a previous game, and yes, I got heartily sick of it.
>So I play a tank. Granted, this tank has a tiny little healing spell that
>does come in handy, but she is primarily a TANK. I spend alot of time
>guarding our male clerics and paladins while they're medding after healing
>my fanny back up to full while I kept them alive long enough to bash the
>mobs on the head a few times and cast Strike or Ward Undead or whichever.
>I
>love the role reversal! And they really do appreciate me taunting critters
>off them and watching them while they meditate. I have received many
>expressions of gratitude, and I love being the one dishin' out the damage.
>The funniest part is that I play a wood elf, who is tiny, and they play
>high
>elves and humans, who are much larger. <chuckles>
> I even have a special emote set up for them: "Sara stands guard over
>the tall one, looking quite fierce!" Got that sucker hotkeyed, and they
>know I'm on duty. =)
> The cleric I play is a dark elf, so she's not really the nurturing
>type
>either. I chose to play a cleric on that server (Rallos Zek) because some
>of the guys from my guild crossed over, and I thought it'd be neat to have
>some ingame role reversal. Also, I liked the concept of being able to
>wander around, pondering aloud whether someone would make an appropriate
>sacrifice to my God, the Prince of Hate. I would like to do that in real
>life some days.
> By the way, Barbarian Shaman ROCK!!!! They're a really cool class,
>and
>the ones I have met enjoy themselves thoroughly. =)
>
>Sara, Povar
>Valdaya, Rallos Zek
>
>terrence wallingford wrote:
>
> > From: terrence wallingford <greenloafers@...>
> >
> > I would just like to tell everyone out there who is a Cleric that they
> > just might like to try out a shaman. I spent 18 levels being a Cleric
> > and 5 being a Shaman so far. I was always frustrated with my
> > limitations as a Cleric and took on way too much responsibility for
> > other people's lives, which made grouping a very un-fun experience. I
> > love being a Shaman so far. ( I've made 2 new characters in Quellios.
> > Bloodless and Blacksatin) Go ahead and laugh at the names, it's the
> > best I can do on such short notice! I agonized believe me. Someone even
> > called me "campy"!- whatever that means. I'm only 25, that term's
> > before my time.
> > Anyway, I've played on that server for a total of 3 days and have
> > noticed, not just me - also complete strangers, that most people on
> > that server are really helpfull and nice. Or maybe just the people in
> > Halas as that's the only town I've been in. I encourage you guys to try
> > it out as I have been so happy. I don't die constantly and I don't have
> > to sit out the action all the time. I get to actually participate as a
> > part of the group instead of staring at my spellbook all the time with
> > nothing to do but chat. Not that chatting is at all bad, but I want to
> > have some fun too!
> > I have noticed that a lot of us have said that we play clerics, it
> > seems more than any other class. (Or maybe I only notice the clerics
> > because I play one.)I hope this doesn't offend you all, but I wonder if
> > we have chosen to play one because we are by nature nurturing and
> > helpfull, or because we have been raised in our society to act servile
> > to men. (I'm sure I've raised a few hackles-sorry!) It bothered me that
> > I would be one of the only women in rl playing a female character in
> > any given group and I would be forced to sit and heal all the male
> > warriors. I grew resentfull. I'm wondering if many of you have done the
> > same thing, or if this just says a lot about me.
> > Thanks! :)
> >
